project.name: mini-pages
project.description: A simple client-side router for Meteor

PageRouter.name: PageRouter
PageRouter.description:
The main mini-pages class. Manages creating pages, rendering and 
responding to url path changes. You can only create one PageRouter instance.

props.name: autoRender
props.description:
Set `false` to render manually 
 (i.e. when you use the {{renderPages}} Handlebars helper

props.name: autoStart
props.description:
Set to `false` to manually decide 
 when to listen for url change events.

props.name: defaults
props.description:
Default options that will be applied to
 all {{#crossLink "PageRouter.Page"}}{{/crossLink}} instances.

PageRouter.Page.name: PageRouter.Page
PageRouter.Page.description:
Controller and container class for a page route. The constructor function
registers the page with the underlying pushState handler. For now, we are
using page-js to do this. You shouldn't create Page instances directly.
Instead, let the PageRouter manage this for you.

params.name: path
params.description: The path associated with the page.

params.name: options
params.description:
Can either be an object
of options, the name of a template, or a function that will act as the
last before filter.

props.name: to
props.description: The name of a template to render.

props.name: as
props.description:
The name used in path helpers. All names
  will get a path helper like this: <name>Path. These path helpers are
  available as methods like Meteor.postShowPath() and as Handlebars helpers.

props.name: layout
props.description: The name of a template to use for a layout.

props.name: nav
props.description:
A key to use for nav. Most useful in applying
  conditional classes to navigation bars.

props.name: before
props.description:
A function or array of functions
  to be called before the layout and template are rendered.

PageRouter.PageInvocation.name: PageRouter.PageInvocation
PageRouter.PageInvocation.description:
Created each time the url path changes and a page is run. The PageInvocation
allows before filters to dynamically set the template, layout and nav, and
provides methods for redirecting, stopping execution of the before filters and
getting and setting page variables that will be cleaned up when a new page
is run.

Instances are created automatically by the PageRouter when a path change
causes the router's run method to be called. The PageInvocation instance
is the value of `this` in all before filters.

classitems.description: Create a bunch of pages at once.
classitems.name: pages

params.name: pages
params.description:
An object of page definitions where the key is a
 url path and the values are options to the 
 {{#crossLink "PageRouter.Page"}}{{/crossLink}} constructor.

classitems.description:
Create a new {{#crossLink "PageRouter.Page"}}{{/crossLink}}
and return it.
classitems.name: match

params.name: options
params.description:
Options to pass to the 
  {{#crossLink "PageRouter.Page"}}{{/crossLink}} constructor.

classitems.description: Navigate to a given path.
classitems.name: go
example:
var router = new Meteor.PageRouter({});
    router.go("/posts/1234", { someState: "" });

params.name: state
params.description: A state object to pass along.

classitems.description:
Automatically start the router by adding a callback to Meteor.startup.
The router is auto started by default.
classitems.name: autoStart

classitems.description:
Start listening for pushState events from the browser and responding
to url changes. Call this to manually start listening. If you call
autoStart() this will automatically be called from within a Meteor.startup
callback. You usually shouldn't need to call this method.
classitems.name: start

classitems.description:
Automatically render the router to the document.body. By default the
router will use autoRender(). If you instead want to render the router's
pages in a particular part of the DOM you can call render() instead and
attach the document fragment manually. For example, the Handlebars helper
{{renderPages}} does this.
classitems.name: autoRender

classitems.description:
Creates two isolated regions. One for the layout and one for the template.
Uses Spark's native reactivity to re-render the layout or template if 
the router's current layout or template changes.
classitems.name: render

return.description:
If called from within Meteor.render
it returns a DocumentFragment, otherwise a string of html.

classitems.description:
If the path is different from the current path, creates a new
{{#crossLink "PageRouter.PageInvocation"}}{{/crossLink}} and runs
the page with the new invocation.
classitems.name: run

classitems.description:
Creates a new {{#crossLink "PageRouter.PageInvocation"}}{{/crossLink}}
and runs the page. Then set's the router's layout, template, nav and
invocation object (the object you get when you call {{page.someprop}} in
your html.
classitems.name: _runWithInvocation

classitems.description:
Get or set the current invocation object. This is the object that is
available in your template html by using the page handlebars helper like
this: {{page.someProperty}}. The object gets its values from a before
filter calling `this.set("key", "value")`. The value is stored in Session
so that it's reactive and survives hot code pushes.
classitems.name: invocation

params.name: value
params.description:
If an object is passed it will be set, otherwise
  the current value will be returned.

return.description:
Returns the current invocation object if no parameter is
  passed.

classitems.description: Reactively get or set the current layout.
classitems.name: layout

params.name: value
params.description: The name of the layout template.

return.description:
If no value passed, return the current layout template
  name.

classitems.description:
Reactively test the current layout name for equality with the passed
value.
classitems.name: layoutEquals

params.name: value
params.description: The name of the layout template to test quality.

return.description: Returns true if the template names are equal.

classitems.description: Reactively get or set the current template.
classitems.name: template

return.description: If no value passed returns the name of the current template.

classitems.description:
Reactively test the current template name for equality with the passed
value.
classitems.name: templateEquals

params.name: value
params.description: The name of the template to test quality.

return.description: Returns true if the template names are equal.

classitems.description: Reactively get or set the current nav key.
classitems.name: nav

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the nav key.

return.description: If no value passed returns the current nav key.

classitems.description:
Reactively test the current nav key for equality with the passed
value.
classitems.name: navEquals

params.name: value
params.description: The nav key to test for equality.

return.description: Returns true if the nav keys are equal.

classitems.description: Returns the router's current url path.
classitems.name: path

classitems.description: Set a default template name for the page.
classitems.name: to

classitems.description: Set the name of the page. Primarily used in path helpers.
classitems.name: as

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the page, and of the path helper prefix.

classitems.description: Set the default nav key for this page.
classitems.name: nav

params.name: nav
params.description: The name of the default nav key to use for this page.

example: page.nav("posts"); // sets the nav key primarily used for nav bars.

classitems.description: Set the default layout for this page.
classitems.name: layout

params.name: layout
params.description: The name of the template to use as a layout.

classitems.description:
A function or array of functions to call before rendering the page. The
before callbacks will be called with `this` set to a
{{#crossLink PageRouter.PageInvocation}}{{/crossLink}} instance.
classitems.name: before

params.name: callbacks
params.description: A function or array of callbacks.

classitems.name: pathWithContext

params.name: context
params.description:
An optional context object to use for
interpolation.

classitems.description:
Run the page with a PageRouter.PageInvocation. Runs the page's before
callbacks and set's the invocation's default layout, template and nav.
Returns the resulting mutated invocation.
Gets or sets the invocation's layout template name.
classitems.name: layout

return.description:
If no value provided, returns the invocation's layout
template name.

classitems.description: Gets or sets the invocation's template name.
classitems.name: template

return.description:
If no value provided, returns the invocation's
template name.

classitems.description: Gets or sets the invocation's nav key.
classitems.name: template

return.description:
If no value provided, returns the invocation's
nav key.

classitems.description: Stops the current page and redirects to a new path.
classitems.name: redirect

params.name: state
params.description: An optional state object to pass along.

classitems.description:
Stops the current page run. Also stops pushState from being called. Call
this to completely stop. No rendering, no more filters.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Returns true if the invocation has been stopped.
classitems.name: isStopped

return.description: True if the stop() method has been called.

classitems.description: Don't run any additional before filters.
classitems.name: done

classitems.description: Returns true if the invocation has been marked as done.
classitems.name: isDone

return.description: True if the done() method has been called.

classitems.description:
Set a page variable that can be accessed for the current invocation from
handlebars or downstream before filters. These will be cleared when a new
page is run (i.e. the url path changes). These values are accessible
using the `page` Handlebars helper.
classitems.name: set

classitems.description: Gets a current invocation value.
classitems.name: get

return.description: The value associated with the key.

classitems.description:
Returns the invocation's dictionary. This is what is put into Session
before the page is rendered.
classitems.name: toObject

classitems.description:
Convenience method to create a new PageRouter instance and call the
pages method on it to create a bunch of pages at once.
classitems.name: Meteor.pages

params.name: pages
params.description: An object of paths to page options.

params.name: options
params.description:
Optional options to pass to the PageRouter
constructor

classitems.description: The {{#crossLink "PageRouter"}}{{/crossLink}} class.
classitems.name: Meteor.PageRouter

classitems.description:
Navigate to the given path with an optional state object to pass along.
This method proxies to the underlying pushState handler. We're currently
using page-js.
classitems.name: Meteor.go

params.name: path
params.description: The path to navigate to. Example: "/posts/1234".
